sentences.en: Achieving this moment of ecstasy easily validates all the pain and struggle of the art form by taking us (and possibly our audience) for a moment to a world beyond our own.
sentences.cn: 达到这狂喜的时刻容易确证艺术上所有的疼痛和奋战的价值，通过使我们（也可能是我们的观众）有那么一小会儿超越自我，进入宇宙的层次。

sentences.en: Again, he felt a crude ecstasy.
sentences.cn: 他又一次从心眼儿里乐开了花.

sentences.en: But what distinguished the physician's ecstasy from Satan's was the trait of wonder in it!
sentences.cn: 不过,那医生的狂喜同撒旦的区别在于,其中尚有惊奇的成分!
戴维逊的双眼发出狂喜的光芒.

sentences.en: Detecting his emotion, Pearl clapped her little hands in the most extravagant ecstasy.
sentences.cn: 珠儿发现了他的激动, 在极度狂喜之中,抬起了小手.

sentences.en: Ecstasy also keeps serotonin from being reabsorbed, further increasing the concentration in the synapse.
sentences.cn: 毒品引起的狂迷还能阻止5—羟色胺的再吸收, 进一步增加了突触内5—羟色胺的浓度.

sentences.en: He listened to the music with ecstasy.
He skipped about the room in an ecstasy.
sentences.cn: 他欣喜若狂地在房间里跳来跳去.

sentences.en: It suggests that ecstasy is like wine, ; and wine is like an eagle clasping you; it's prey in its claws.
sentences.cn: 这里暗示着令人着迷的狂喜如同美酒一般，而酒又像是紧紧抓着你的鹰;,用它的利爪疯狂地掠夺着你所有的。

sentences.en: It was an ecstasy beyond description, complete surrender.
sentences.cn: 这是无法形容的迷醉, 是彻头彻尾的放纵.

sentences.en: Kerouac does manage now and then to convey a Whitmanesque ecstasy.
sentences.cn: 凯鲁亚克有时确能传达那种惠特曼式神韵.

sentences.en: One wondered what heights of ecstasy the winner reached.
sentences.cn: 人们想知道胜者欣喜若狂到了什么程度。

sentences.en: She was in a trancelike state of religious ecstasy.
sentences.cn: 她的宗教狂热已使她处于恍惚状态之中.

sentences.en: She was lost in ecstasy at the sight.
sentences.cn: 看到这情景,她高兴得不得了.

sentences.en: Speechless with ecstasy , the little boys gazed at the toys.
sentences.cn: 小孩注视着那些玩具,高兴得说不出话来.

sentences.en: The touch of her hand had filled him with ecstasy.
sentences.cn: 摸一摸她的手都会使他欣喜若狂.

sentences.en: You learned the dry - mouthed, fear - purged, purging ecstasy of battle.
sentences.cn: 你体会到战斗中那种使人嘴巴发干的, 战胜了恐惧并排除其他杂念的狂喜.

trans.tran_cn: 狂喜，出神，忘形，无法自控的情绪，迷幻药
trans.tran_en: an illegal drug that gives a feeling of happiness and energy. Ecstasy is especially used by people who go out to dance at clubs and parties.
